answers.answer: You don't mention if you are on insulin.  But the best diet for type 2 diabetes is the low carb diet.  Check with your doctor if you'd like to give it a try.  When you eat low carb, you're not stimulating the pancreas all the time to make insulin, which leads to insulin resistance, which leads to diabetes.   I have a few friends that tried it and they no longer had blood sugar problems, but they have a hard time sticking with it.   Even if you could manage to stay away from high glycemic carbs for 2 out of 3 meals a day, it would help your blood sugar.  As for the "plaque", if it is yeast, a low carb diet will help get rid of it.  But, of course, I don't know what it is that you have.  A doctor would have to diagnose your problem.  I hope this helps.

question: my sugar level is 200 to 300 type 2 and my vagina area is red a little discharge was seen looks like plague
title: type 2 diabetic
